definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to knock at the gate (old)/to make an approach/to invade/to attack the goal (sports)
to kneel three times and kowtow nine times (formal etiquette on meeting the emperor)

sentences.english: The only sound was the soft scruff of their feet upon the steps.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的聲響便是他們的腳叩在石階上的聲音。

sentences.english: Do you know what a kokle is?
sentences.chinese: 你知道什麼是叩叩琴嗎？

sentences.english: The kokle is the manic-depressive of the string family.
sentences.chinese: 叩叩琴可以說是絃樂器家族當中的躁狂抑鬱症。

sentences.english: Especially likes in the rainy day knocking on the wet front door.
sentences.chinese: 尤其喜歡在雨天去叩溼溼的大門。

sentences.english: They had an old kokle they let me borrow.
sentences.chinese: 他們借給我一箇舊的叩叩琴。

sentences.english: Just the act of bowing and prostrating with your face flat on the floor removes all the trappings of this life.
sentences.chinese: 它僅僅是以鞠躬和麪部叩地的動作消除一生的裝飾。

sentences.english: On the day when death will knock at thy door what wilt thou offer to him?
sentences.chinese: 當死神來叩你門的時候，你將以什麼貢獻他呢？

sentences.english: Who strikes jade with gold, you know?
And it was like knocking four quick times at the door of unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 然而，那卻好像是我在苦難之門上短促地叩了四下。

sentences.english: ConclusionThe effect of discharging sputum with machine vibration is better than percussion on back.
sentences.chinese: 結論振動排痰機的排痰效果優於人工叩背排痰法。

sentences.english: Who is it that comes slowly to my door and gently knocks？
sentences.chinese: 是誰慢慢地來到我的門前輕輕地敲叩？

definition: to bump one's head/to kowtow with head-banging on the ground
to kowtow/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to kneel as in prayer (without sitting back on the heels)
to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)
to kneel down/to sink to one's knees/to grovel
to bow down low/to make obeisance/to kneel and bow
to bow deeply, starting upright with arms straight out in front, one hand cupped in the other, then moving the hands down to one's knees as one bows, keeping the arms straight (a form of greeting)
